values: This journal is Friends-Locked. Comment to be added to my friends list. And remember to state WHY you want to be added. :) Doesn't have to be anything all too good, I just want to know. If you're looking for FanFic or other such things, I have a journal run by my muses at for works-in-progress, a graphics journal at , original fiction at , , and , and communities at and for finished fanfic and art. :)
Did you spot one of your userpics in my collection? Is it improperly credited? Or not credited at all? Let me know here and I'll fix it once I get your comment! :D

THIS IS A MEME. THESE ARE THE RULES OF THE MEME: 1. Click on this link here. It will take you to my character list. 2. Now go to your own character list. I don't have a link for that. What do you think I am, a stalker? 3. Look at our lists. Compare. Are there any people on your list that wanna talk to any people on my list? If so, move onto step four. 4. Comment on this post with your character and a specification of who they want to talk to. Or not--I'm open for open posts. You can also link to one-off if that's what you wanna do. I'm cool! 5. HAVE FUN. THIS IS A REQUIREMENT. >:| (That last character on my list? Miss Solus? She's off limits. I'm not prepared to reveal the project she was created for yet. >.> Anyone else is fair game~ :D)

Erm, so, I feel like writing some random Stargate SG-1 crossovers. So! Someone, give me a fandom and some prompts and I'll see what I can do. ;) (My fandoms are listed in the sidebar on the right; I won't write it if I don't know the fandom ;) There are a few I'm in that aren't listed there though. >_>)
Any other Phantom of the Opera fans will probably enjoy it too ;)

Potterdammerung has arrived, bitches.

Any one who tries to comment with spoilers will be stabbed, strung up, and burned (and by that I mean reported). End of story.

No wank either. I don't want to hear it. It's JKR's book and no-one else's.

*sets up an anti-wank barrier and hides behind it*

We would like to know who really believes in gay rights on livejournal. There is no bribe of a miracle or anything like that. If you truly believe in gay rights, then repost this and title the post as "Gay Rights". If you don't believe in gay rights, then just ignore this. Thanks.

Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind.

Some may have noticed that my "Friends Only" entry is now in both English and German; that's because I aim to practice my German by writing some of my entries in both English and German (I'm not THAT cruel, guys).

This entry, however, is not one of the German/English entries. Because I am currently unable to translate, being in ANTH tutoring. >.>

Biting off more than I can chew, that is. Anyway, making a claim in for AtLA/SG-1. The Fic shall be written according to the prompts. Sort of. >.>

I've just finished watching "The Guru/The Crossroads of Destiny", and I have to say... I was EXTREMELY disappointed. But really only in one thing. Other than that particular thing, the plot of AtLA has thickened further and it looks as if the Earth King might be a permanent addition to the gAang. (A term which apparently coined and which I have since ganked fully.)

That said, I am EXTREMELY disappointed in Zuko. For all appearances in "The Guru", he really HAD changed, but then what happens? He chooses to side with his lying bitch of a sister instead of Aang. This will change in my AtLA/SG-1 crossover and in the DBFS-verse, but that'll be discussed in part II.

Of course, it's entirely possible that Zuko actually IS siding with Aang; he's just trying to take Azula down by gaining her trust. I really do hope this is the case.

If not, however, I still have a small hope. I for one have a hard time believing Ozai will ever accept Zuko back as his son, and especially not as a "war hero", as Azula put it. Ozai is NOT the forgiving sort. So I maintain the hope that Zuko will return home, and STILL be rejected by Ozai, then betray Azula and his father and side with Aang. *fingerscrossed*

Iroh still looks to be an addition to the gAang, as it's plainly obvious he does not approve of Zuko's choice. He also seems to like Aang a lot, and he's already friends with Toph. >.> I still maintain that Iroh will teach Aang to Firebend, since Aang seems to have gotten over his phobia of Firebending thanks to our friendly neighbourhood Guru.

Also, the incorporation of the Hindu or Buddhist (I think it's Hindu, but it could be Buddhist... it's been two years since my world religions class and I don't think we covered that >.>) concept of Chakras was BRILLIANT, as well.

Of course, Aang couldn't release his attachment to Katara, which was required to "open" his seventh Chakra, but the moment he did later in the episode, he got struck down by Azula. (Methinks the writers are saying something about non-attachment.) The imagery during that moment, when Aang was trying to open that Chakra was AWESOME, though what he had to do to achieve that reminded me SORELY of the Jedi. (An intentional reference, maybe?)

And, OH! How cool was Iroh's Firebreath?! XD XD XD He literally sipped some tea and then breathed fire. That was AWESOME. Iroh ROCKS.

As does Toph, who can now Metalbend! (She'll have to teach that one to Aang, definitely.)

And speaking of awesome Bending, Zuko's Firewhips = <3<3<3<3<3.

All in all, awesome storyline, and some truly awesome Bending to be had. XD

Finally got everything uploaded! The forum seems to be experiencing some technical difficulties (says it can't connect to the database, but I suspect that's because I was FTPing files), but otherwise, it's good to go. :)

Homophobia We are the couple who had the realtor hang up on us when she found out we wanted to rent a one-bedroom for two men. I am the person who never knows which bathroom I should use if I want to avoid getting the management called on me. I am the mother who is not allowed to even visit the children I bore, nursed, and raised. The court says I am an unfit mother because I now live with another woman. I am the domestic-violence survivor who found the support system grow suddenly cold and distant when they found out my abusive partner is also a woman. I am the domestic-violence survivor who has no support system to turn to because I am male. I am the father who has never hugged his son because I grew up afraid to show affection to other men. I am the boy who never finished high school, because I got called a fag every day I am the girl kicked out of her home because I confided in my mother that I am a lesbian. I am the prostitute working the streets because nobody will hire a transsexual woman. I am the sister who holds her gay brother tight through the painful, tear-filled nights. We are the parents who buried our daughter long before her time. I am the man who died alone in the hospital because they would not let my partner of twenty-seven years into the room. I am the foster child who wakes up with nightmares of being taken away from the two fathers who are the only loving family I have ever had. I wish they could adopt me. I am not one of the lucky ones. I killed myself just weeks before graduating high school. I am the woman who died when the EMTs stopped treating me as soon as they realized I was transsexual. I am the person who feels guilty because I think I could be a much better person if I didnt have to always deal with society hating me. I am the man who stopped attending church, not because I don't believe, but because they closed their doors to my kind. I am the person who has to hide what this world needs most, love. I am the person ashamed to tell my own friends im a lesbian, because they constantly make fun of them. I am the boy tied to a fence, beaten to a bloody pulp and left to die because two straight men wanted to "teach me a lesson" ---IF YOU BELIEVE THAT HOMOPHOBIA IS WRONG... REPOST THIS
